paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 3 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

section.name: s68
section.heading: Examination by authorities outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: The appropriate recognized banking supervisory authority of a place outside Hong Kong may, with the approval of the Monetary Authority, examine— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 168)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the books, accounts and transactions of the principal place of business in Hong Kong, or any local branch or local office, of an authorized institution which— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 13)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is incorporated in that place or in respect of which the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the authority has primary supervisory responsibility; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and is a subsidiary of a company which is incorporated in that place or in respect of which the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the authority has primary supervisory responsibility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the documents of any local representative office of a bank which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is incorporated in that place or in respect of which the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the authority has primary supervisory responsibility; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is a subsidiary of a company which is incorporated in that place or in respect of which the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that the authority has primary supervisory responsibility.

subsection.content: A reference to a company in subsection (1)(a)(ii) and (b)(ii) does not include a re-domiciled entity. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 168)

section.name: s68A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: recovery plan (恢復計劃) means— (a)a plan required under section 68C(1); or(b)if the plan is revised under section 68E, the revised plan.

section.name: s68B
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Part applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized institution incorporated outside Hong Kong, which operates in Hong Kong through a branch.

section.name: s68C
section.heading: Requirements to prepare, maintain and submit recovery plan

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on an authorized institution, require the institution to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare and maintain a plan setting out the measures that the institution can take to stabilize and restore its financial resources and viability when the institution comes under severe stress; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit (including periodically submit) the plan to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form of, and the standards applicable to, a recovery plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the elements to be included in the plan, and the way they are to be included.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may specify that a recovery plan must include—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a range of material and feasible recovery options that could be implemented by the institution to stabilize and restore its financial resources and viability, including the maintaining of capital and liquidity at levels adequate for the nature, scale and complexity of the institution’s operations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a process for activating the plan by the institution, including—

subparagraph.content: the process for deciding on the appropriate course of action; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a communication plan to ensure timely communication when the recovery plan is activated and the measures in the plan are implemented.

section.name: s68D
section.heading: General power to impose requirements

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on an authorized institution, impose requirements on the institution in relation to its recovery plan.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the requirements may relate to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the frequency of review of the recovery plan;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the governance arrangements within the institution for oversight of the recovery planning process and the process for activating the plan and implementing the measures in the plan.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must not impose the requirements unless the Monetary Authority considers the imposition necessary or expedient to ensure that the authorized institution’s recovery plan is fit for the purpose of stabilizing and restoring its financial resources and viability when the institution comes under severe stress.
In imposing the requirements, the Monetary Authority may have regard to the nature, scale and complexity of the authorized institution’s operations.

section.name: s68E
section.heading: Requirement to revise recovery plan

subsection.content: This section applies if the Monetary Authority considers that there is a deficiency or impediment in the recovery plan of an authorized institution, including, for example, in the measures in the plan.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the deficiency or impediment in the institution’s recovery plan, including, for example, in the measures in the plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the institution to submit a revised recovery plan within the period specified in the notice demonstrating how the deficiency or impediment has been addressed.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorized institution fails to comply with the requirement imposed in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority considers that the deficiency or impediment has not been adequately addressed by the revised recovery plan submitted by the institution,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the institution, require it to make specific revisions to the plan within the period specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The period specified under subsection (2)(b) or (3) must be reasonable in the circumstances.

section.name: s68F
section.heading: Requirement to implement recovery plan

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Monetary Authority considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution is delaying the implementation of one or more of the measures in its recovery plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the delay is injurious to the financial soundness and viability of the institution; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the institution’s implementation of the measure or measures is necessary to—

subparagraph.content: stabilize and restore the financial resources and viability of the institution; and
avoid an unacceptable risk to the general stability and effective working of the financial system in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the institution that the Monetary Authority intends to require it to implement one or more of the measures in its recovery plan as specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons why the Monetary Authority has the intention.

subsection.content: The authorized institution may, within the period specified in the notice, make representations in writing to the Monetary Authority as to why the Monetary Authority should not impose the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority decides to impose the requirement, the Monetary Authority must by notice in writing served on the authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the institution of the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the institution to implement, within the period specified in the notice, the measure or measures in its recovery plan as specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The period specified under subsection (3) or (4)(c) must be reasonable in the circumstances.
A decision of the Monetary Authority to impose a requirement under subsection (4) is a decision to which section 101B(1) applies.

section.name: s68G
section.heading: Requirement to notify

subsection.leadIn: If an event that requires an authorized institution to implement a measure in its recovery plan occurs or is likely to occur, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the matter, notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after being notified to do so, provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requires.

subsection.leadIn: If the authorized institution decides to implement a measure in its recovery plan, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after making the decision, notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after being notified to do so, provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requires.

section.name: s68H
section.heading: Holding company of authorized institution

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may exercise a power mentioned in sections 68C, 68D, 68E and 68F in relation to a holding company of an authorized institution if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 169)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong by or under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), a former Companies Ordinance as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), or any other Ordinance; or
is a re-domiciled entity; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 169)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority considers the exercise of the power necessary or expedient to promote—

subparagraph.content: the financial soundness and viability of the institution; or
the general stability and effective working of the financial system in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a reference to an authorized institution in section 68C, 68D, 68E or 68F is a reference to the holding company.

subsection.leadIn: If an event that requires the holding company to implement a measure in its recovery plan occurs or is likely to occur, the company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the matter, notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after being notified to do so, provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requires.

subsection.leadIn: If the holding company decides to implement a measure in its recovery plan, the company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after making the decision, notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after being notified to do so, provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requires.

section.name: s68I
section.heading: Offences relating to recovery planning

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 68G, or a requirement of a notice served under section 68C(1), 68D(1), 68E(3) or 68F(4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the institution commits an offence and is liable—

subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at tier 9 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 5 for every day during which the offence continues; or
on summary conviction—to a fine at tier 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not the institution is charged with or convicted of the offence, every director, every chief executive and every manager of the institution also commits the offence and is liable—

subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at tier 9 and to imprisonment for 5 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 5 for every day during which the offence continues; or
on summary conviction—to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: If a holding company of an authorized institution, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 68H(3) or (4), or a requirement of a notice served by the Monetary Authority in the exercise of the Monetary Authority’s powers under section 68H(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the company commits an offence and is liable—

subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at tier 9 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 5 for every day during which the offence continues; or
on summary conviction—to a fine at tier 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not the company is charged with or convicted of the offence, every officer of the company also commits the offence and is liable—

subparagraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at tier 9 and to imprisonment for 5 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 5 for every day during which the offence continues; or
on summary conviction—to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

def.name: Officer
def.leadIn: officer (高級人員), in relation to a holding company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer or a deputy chief executive officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is employed by, or acts for or on behalf of or under an arrangement with, the company and is principally responsible, alone or jointly with others, for—

subparagraph.content: the management of part of the business of the company; or
the performance of one or more of the control functions of the company.

subsection.leadIn: In the definition of officer in subsection (3)—
subsection.def: deputy chief executive officer (副行政總裁) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628).

part.name: P13
part.heading: Ownership and Management of Authorized Institutions

section.name: s69
section.heading: Amalgamation, etc. requires approval

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong shall not, without the prior approval in writing of the Monetary Authority— (Amended 3 of 1990 s. 28; 82 of 1992 s. 25; 49 of 1995 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make any arrangement or enter into any agreement for the sale or disposal of all or any part of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a bank, its banking business; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a restricted licence bank or a deposit-taking company, its business of taking deposits. (Amended 3 of 1990 s. 28; E.R. 6 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes any arrangement or enters into any agreement for the sale or disposal of all or any part of its business, irrespective of whether the arrangement or agreement is pursuant to an approval under subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes any reconstruction of its capital, (Amended 95 of 1991 s. 17)

subsection.continued: shall give notice in writing of the arrangement, agreement or reconstruction, as the case may be, to the Monetary Authority as soon as practicable after making that arrangement, entering into that agreement or making that reconstruction, and—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the notice shall be signed by a director of the institution; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the institution shall provide the Monetary Authority with such information in respect of that arrangement, agreement or reconstruction as he may require. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: Every director, every chief executive and every manager of an authorized institution which contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.content: Every director, every chief executive and every manager of an authorized institution which contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction upon indictment or on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27; 32 of 2001 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution produces any information whatsoever under this section which is false in a material particular, every director, every chief executive and every manager of the institution commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 8 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

section.name: s70
section.heading: Provisions applicable to persons proposing to become controllers, and to certain existing controllers, of authorized institutions incorporated in Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: This section shall apply to a person becoming or being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a majority shareholder controller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an indirect controller,

subsection.continued: of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong as it applies to a person becoming or being, as the case may be, a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: conditional notice of consent (有條件同意通知書) means a notice of consent referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of notice of consent;

def.name: NoticeOfConsent
def.leadIn: notice of consent (同意通知書) means a notice in writing specifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no objection to the person specified in that notice becoming or being, as the case may be, a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution specified in that notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions subject to which there is no objection to the person specified in that notice becoming or being, as the case may be, a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution specified in that notice;

subsection.def: notice of objection (反對通知書) means a notice in writing objecting to the person specified in that notice becoming or being, as the case may be, a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution specified in that notice.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), no person shall become a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has served on the Monetary Authority a notice in writing stating that he proposes to become such a controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (17), the Monetary Authority has, before the expiration of 3 months from the date of service of that notice, served on him a notice of consent; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that period has expired without the Monetary Authority having served on him a notice of objection.

subsection.leadIn: A notice referred to in subsection (3)(a) served on the Monetary Authority by a person shall not be regarded as compliance with that subsection except as respects that person becoming a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution to which the notice relates before the expiration of 12 months from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that person has been served with a notice of consent, on the date on which he was so served;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where that person has been served with a notice of objection in respect of which an appeal under section 132A(3) has been successful, on the date on which the appeal was successful. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution in contravention of subsection (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know that the acts or circumstances by virtue of which he became such a controller were such as to have that effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsequently becomes aware of the fact that he has become such a controller,

subsection.continued: he shall serve on the Monetary Authority, not later than 14 days after becoming aware of that fact, a notice in writing stating that he has become such a controller.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (7), (8), (9) and (10), the Monetary Authority may serve—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice of objection,

subsection.continued: on a person.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a conditional notice of consent served on a person who has become the minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution may revoke a prior notice of consent, if any, served on the person in relation to the person becoming or being, as the case may be, such a controller. (Added 42 of 1999 s. 7)

Without limiting the generality of conditions which the Monetary Authority may specify in a conditional notice of consent, he may specify in the notice such conditions as he may think proper to safeguard the interests of depositors and potential depositors of the authorized institution specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall not serve a notice of objection on a person where the Monetary Authority is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the interests of depositors and potential depositors of that institution would not be or are not, as the case may be, in some other manner threatened by that person becoming or being, as the case may be, such a controller; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where that person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: is not presently such a controller, that, having regard to that person’s likely influence on that institution if he was to become such a controller—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: if the Monetary Authority is of any other opinion, that person is likely to undertake adequate remedial action;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: is presently such a controller, that, having regard to that person’s influence on that institution as such a controller—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that that institution was conducting its business prudently before that person became such a controller, the institution is presently, and is likely to continue, so conducting its business;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the Monetary Authority is of any other opinion, that person is presently undertaking, or is likely to undertake, adequate remedial action.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall not serve a notice of objection on a person who has become a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution— (Amended 42 of 1999 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless he has become such a controller in contravention of subsection (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (17), after the expiration of 3 months immediately following the Monetary Authority becoming aware of such contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall, before serving a conditional notice of consent or notice of objection on a person, serve on that person a preliminary notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the Monetary Authority is considering the service on him of a conditional notice of consent or notice of objection, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the Monetary Authority is considering the service on him of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a conditional notice of consent, specifying the conditions which the Monetary Authority proposes to specify in the notice;

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating that he may, within 1 month from the date of service of the preliminary notice, make written representations to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: Where representations are made in accordance with subsection (10)(c), the Monetary Authority shall take them into account in deciding whether to serve the conditional notice of consent or notice of objection, as the case may be, concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A conditional notice of consent served on a person may specify conditions which were not specified in the preliminary notice served under subsection (10) on that person where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person consents to those conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsequent preliminary notice specifying those conditions has been served under that subsection on that person. (Replaced 17 of 2018 s. 62)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of objection served on a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, subject to paragraph (b), specify which of the matters referred to in subsection (8) in respect of which the Monetary Authority is not satisfied; and (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 62)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not specify any such matters which were not specified in the preliminary notice served under subsection (10) on that person. (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 62)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority shall not be obliged to disclose to a person any particulars of the matters referred to in subsection (8) on which he is considering the service on him or has served on him, as the case may be, a notice of objection.

Where the Monetary Authority pursuant to section 72A requires a person who has given a notice in writing under subsection (3)(a) or (5) to submit information, the time between imposing that requirement and the receipt of the information shall be added to the period referred to in subsection (3)(b) or (9)(b), as the case may be.

The period referred to in subsection (3)(b) or (9)(b) (together with any extension under subsection (16)) shall not expire, if it would otherwise do so, until 14 days after the expiration of the period within which representations can be made in accordance with subsection (10)(c).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (19), any person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 8 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.content: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (18), it shall be a defence to prove that he did not know that the acts or circumstances by virtue of which he became a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution concerned were such as to have that effect.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes any condition specified in a conditional notice of consent served on him commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

section.name: s70A
section.heading: Objection to existing controllers

subsection.leadIn: This section shall apply to a person being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a majority shareholder controller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an indirect controller,

subsection.continued: of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong as it applies to a person being a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.def: In this section, unless the context otherwise requires, notice of objection (反對通知書) means a notice in writing objecting to the person specified in that notice being a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution specified in that notice.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the Monetary Authority may serve a notice of objection on a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: who is a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his being such a controller is not in contravention of section 70(3); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: his being such a controller is in contravention of that section but the Monetary Authority is prohibited by virtue of section 70(9)(b) from serving a notice of objection under section 70(6) on him; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where it appears to the Monetary Authority that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that person is not or is no longer a fit and proper person to be such a controller;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the interests of depositors or potential depositors of that institution may be in some other manner threatened by that person being such a controller; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that person has contravened any condition specified in a conditional notice of consent served under section 70(6) on him.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall, before serving a notice of objection on a person, serve on that person a preliminary notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the Monetary Authority is considering the service on him of a notice of objection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying which of the matters referred to in subsection (3)(b) in respect of which the Monetary Authority is considering the service on him of the notice of objection; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating that he may, within 1 month from the date of service of the preliminary notice, make written representations to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: Where representations are made in accordance with subsection (4)(c), the Monetary Authority shall take them into account in deciding whether to serve the notice of objection concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of objection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, subject to paragraph (b), specify which of the matters referred to in subsection (3)(b) on which the notice is served;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not specify any such matters which were not specified in the preliminary notice served under subsection (4) on him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall give particulars of the right conferred by subsection (8).

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority shall not be obliged to disclose to a person any particulars of the matters referred to in subsection (3)(b) on which he is considering the service on him or has served on him, as the case may be, a notice of objection.

section.name: s70B
section.heading: Restrictions on and sale of shares

subsection.content: This section shall apply to a person being a majority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong as it applies to a person being a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The powers conferred by this section shall be exercisable where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has become a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution in contravention of section 70(3) in that—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: no notice in writing has been served under section 70(5) in respect of that contravention;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: a notice in writing has been served under section 70(5) on the Monetary Authority by that person in respect of that contravention, the Monetary Authority has served a notice of objection under section 70(6) on that person in respect of that contravention, and either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the period specified in the Administrative Appeals Rules (Cap. 1 sub. leg. A) within which that person may appeal under section 132A(3) against the decision of the Monetary Authority to serve such notice of objection has expired without any such appeal having been made; or (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an appeal under section 132A(3) by that person against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection is unsuccessful; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that person has been convicted of an offence under section 70(18) in respect of that contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: continues to be a minority shareholder controller of an authorized institution after having been served with a notice of objection under section 70A(3) in respect of his being such a controller and either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period specified in the Administrative Appeals Rules (Cap. 1 sub. leg. A) within which that person may appeal under section 132A(3) against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection has expired without any such appeal having been made; or (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an appeal under section 132A(3) by that person against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection is unsuccessful. (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (8), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the person concerned, direct that any specified shares to which this section applies shall, until further notice, be subject to one or more of the following restrictions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting rights shall be exercisable in respect of the shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further shares shall be issued in right of them or pursuant to any offer made to their holder;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in a liquidation, no payment shall be made of any sums due from the authorized institution, or other company, concerned on the shares, whether in respect of capital or otherwise.

subsection.content: Where shares are subject to the restrictions under subsection (3)(a), any agreement to transfer the shares or, in the case of unissued shares, the right to be issued with them, shall be void.

Where shares are subject to the restrictions under subsection (3)(c) or (d), an agreement to transfer any right to be issued with other shares in right of those shares, or to receive any payment on them (otherwise than in a liquidation), shall be void.

subsection.leadIn: Where shares are subject to any restrictions under subsection (3), any person affected by any of those restrictions may request the Monetary Authority to make an application referred to in subsection (7)(a) in respect of those shares and, where such a request is made, the Monetary Authority shall, not later than 1 month after that request has been made—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comply with that request; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: serve a notice in writing on that person stating that he does not propose to comply with that request.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9), the Court of First Instance may— (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the application of the Monetary Authority, order the sale of any specified shares to which this section applies and, if they are for the time being subject to any restrictions under subsection (3), that they shall cease to be subject to those restrictions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the application of a person who has made a request under subsection (6) where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: paragraph (b) of that subsection applies in respect of that request; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he has been served with a notice in writing under paragraph (b)(ii) of that subsection in respect of that request; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the period specified in that subsection has expired and neither of the events referred to in paragraph (b) of that subsection has occurred in respect of that request,

paragraph.continued: order the sale of any shares to which that request relates and that they shall cease to be subject to any restrictions under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority has, by virtue of subsection (2)(a)(ii), served a notice in writing under subsection (3) on the person concerned and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person has, not later than 14 days after the service of that notice, served a notice in writing under section 70(5) on the Monetary Authority in respect of the contravention of section 70(3) to which that first-mentioned notice relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no notice of objection under section 70(6) has been served by the Monetary Authority on that person in respect of that contravention within the period in respect of which section 70(9)(b) permits such a notice of objection to be so served; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such a notice of objection has been so served within that period but an appeal under section 132A(3) by that person against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection is successful, (Amended 4 of 1997 s. 27)

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority shall forthwith serve a notice in writing on that person to the effect that the first-mentioned notice is revoked.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall not, by virtue of subsection (2)(a)(ii), make an application referred to in subsection (7)(a) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application relates to shares which are the subject of a notice in writing under subsection (3); and

content.leadIn: the person upon whom that notice has been served has not, within 14 days after the service of that notice, served a notice in writing under section 70(5) in respect of the contravention of section 70(3) to which that first-mentioned notice relates:

subsection.proviso: Provided that this subsection shall be without prejudice to the Monetary Authority’s power, by virtue of subsection (2)(a)(iii), to subsequently make such an application in respect of those shares. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 19)

subsection.content: Where an order has been made under subsection (7), the Court of First Instance may, on the application of the Monetary Authority, make such further order relating to the sale or transfer of the shares as it thinks fit (including an order that the holder of the shares shall cause the shares to be transferred to a nominee of the Monetary Authority specified in the order and within the period specified in the order). (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 32 of 2001 s. 14)

Where shares are sold pursuant to an order under this section, the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale, shall, unless otherwise specified by the Court of First Instance, be paid into court for the benefit of the persons beneficially interested in them, and any such person may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or part of the proceeds be paid to him. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 32 of 2001 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: This section shall apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to all the shares in the authorized institution concerned by virtue of which the person concerned is a minority shareholder controller of the institution which are held by him or any associate of his and were not so held immediately before he became such a controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person concerned became a minority shareholder controller of the authorized institution concerned by virtue of the acquisition by him or any associate of his of shares in another company, to all the shares in that company which are held by him or any associate of his and were not so held immediately before he became such a controller.

subsection.content: A copy of a notice in writing served under subsection (3) or (8) on the person concerned shall be served on the authorized institution or other company to whose shares it relates and, if it relates to shares held by any associate of that person, on that associate.
The Chief Justice may make rules regulating the practice and procedure in connection with applications (including any class of applications) made under subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operation of subsection (3)(b) shall not of itself cause any person to contravene section 70;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order under subsection (10) in relation to the shares may be made at the same time as an order under subsection (7) in relation to the shares. (Added 32 of 2001 s. 14)

section.name: s70C
section.heading: Prohibition on certain persons acting as indirect controllers

def.name: ProhibitedPerson
def.leadIn: In this section, prohibited person (受禁制的人), in relation to an authorized institution, means any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: who has been served with a notice of objection under section 70(6) in respect of his becoming or being, as the case may be, an indirect controller of the institution and either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period specified in the Administrative Appeals Rules (Cap. 1 sub. leg. A) within which that person may appeal under section 132A(3) against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection has expired without any such appeal having been made; or (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an appeal under section 132A(3) by that person against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection is unsuccessful; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who has been served with a notice of objection under section 70A(3) in respect of his being an indirect controller of the institution and either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period specified in the Administrative Appeals Rules (Cap. 1 sub. leg. A) within which that person may appeal under section 132A(3) against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection has expired without any such appeal having been made; or (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an appeal under section 132A(3) by that person against the decision of the Monetary Authority to so serve such notice of objection is unsuccessful. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25)

subsection.content: No person who is a prohibited person in respect of an authorized institution shall act or continue to act, as the case may be, as an indirect controller of the institution and, accordingly, as such a controller shall not give or shall cease to give, as the case may be, any directions or instructions to the directors of the institution or of another company of which it is a subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: Where any director of an authorized institution or of another company of which it is a subsidiary is given (whether directly or indirectly) any directions or instructions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a person whom the director knows, or ought reasonably to know, is a prohibited person in respect of the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are, or might reasonably be construed as being, prohibited from being so given by virtue of subsection (2),

subsection.continued: the director shall forthwith notify the Monetary Authority of those directions or instructions and the circumstances in which they were so given. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: Any prohibited person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 8 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: Any director who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s70D
section.heading: Punishment for attempted evasion of restrictions

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exercises or purports to exercise any right to dispose of any shares, or of any right to be issued with any such shares, knowing that to do so contravenes any restrictions under section 70B(3) to which the shares are subject; (Replaced 32 of 2001 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: votes in respect of any such shares as holder or proxy knowing that to do so contravenes any such restrictions; (Replaced 32 of 2001 s. 15)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: appoints a proxy in respect of any such shares knowing that to vote in respect of any such shares would contravene any such restrictions; (Replaced 32 of 2001 s. 15)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: being the holder of any such shares, fails to notify of their being subject to those restrictions any person whom he does not know to be aware of that fact but does know to be entitled (apart from the restrictions) to vote in respect of those shares whether as holder or as proxy; or (Replaced 32 of 2001 s. 15)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: being the holder of any such shares, or being entitled to any right to be issued with other shares in right of them, or to receive any payment on them (otherwise than in a liquidation), enters into any agreement which is void under section 70B(4) or (5), (Added 32 of 2001 s. 15)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Where shares in an authorized institution or another company are issued in contravention of restrictions under section 70B(3), or payments are made by an authorized institution or another company in contravention of such restrictions, any director, chief executive or manager of the authorized institution or other company, as the case may be, who knowingly and wilfully permits such an issue of shares or the making of such a payment, as the case may be, commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 24; 19 of 2005 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Chief executives and directors require Monetary Authority’s consent

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 53C(5), no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: become—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the chief executive of an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a director of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong,

paragraph.continued: without the consent in writing of the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a condition attached under subsection (2)(b) or (5) as such condition is in force from time to time; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: act or continue to act as such chief executive or director after such consent has been withdrawn under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall refuse to give consent under subsection (1) unless the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the person concerned is a fit and proper person to be the chief executive or a director of the authorized institution concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may give consent under subsection (1) subject to such conditions as the Monetary Authority thinks proper to attach thereto for the purpose of securing, or further securing, that the person concerned will continue to be a fit and proper person to be the chief executive or a director of the authorized institution concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority gives consent, or refuses to give consent, under subsection (1), he shall, as soon as is reasonably practicable, thereafter give notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of the refusal, to the person concerned and the authorized institution concerned and specifying his reasons.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has given to the chief executive or director not less than 7 days’ advance notice of his decision, specifying his reasons, and accompanied by a copy of this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has taken into account any written representation received by him from the chief executive or director,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the chief executive or director and the institution, withdraw the consent.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has decided that he is satisfied that conditions need to be attached to a consent given under subsection (1), or that conditions attached to any such consent need to be amended, for the purpose of securing, or further securing, that the chief executive or director of the authorized institution to whom the consent relates will continue to be a fit and proper person to be such chief executive or director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has given to the chief executive or director not less than 7 days’ advance notice of his decision, specifying his reasons, and accompanied by a copy of this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has taken into account any written representation received by him from the chief executive or director,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the chief executive or director and the institution, attach conditions to the consent, or amend conditions attached to the consent, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: A person shall not be regarded for the purposes of subsection (1) as becoming the chief executive or a director of an authorized institution if he is appointed to serve as such chief executive or director immediately on the expiration of a previous term by him as such chief executive or director.

For the purposes of this section, where a person has the consent of the Monetary Authority under subsection (1) to be the chief executive of an authorized institution, and is such chief executive, he is not required to have the consent of the Monetary Authority under subsection (1) to be a director of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: Where immediately before the commencement* of section 16 of the Banking (Amendment) Ordinance 2001 (32 of 2001) a person had, or was regarded as having, the Monetary Authority’s consent (former consent) under this section as then in force (former section) to be the chief executive or a director of an authorized institution, then, on and after that commencement*—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former consent shall be deemed to be the Monetary Authority’s consent (deemed consent) under subsection (1) for the person to be that chief executive or director, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any conditions attached under the former section to the former consent shall be deemed to be conditions attached under subsection (2)(b) to the deemed consent,

subsection.continued: and subsections (4), (5) and (8) shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s71C
section.heading: Executive officers of registered institutions require Monetary Authority’s consent

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 71E and 71F, no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: become an executive officer of a registered institution without the consent in writing of the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he becomes such executive officer without such consent, act or continue to act as such executive officer without such consent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a condition attached under subsection (2)(b) or (9) as such condition is in force from time to time; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: act or continue to act as such executive officer after such consent has been withdrawn under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall refuse to give consent under subsection (1) unless the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the person concerned—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a fit and proper person to be an executive officer of the registered institution concerned; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has sufficient authority within the institution to be such executive officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may give consent under subsection (1) subject to such conditions as the Monetary Authority thinks proper to attach thereto.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority gives consent, or refuses to give consent, under subsection (1), he shall as soon as is reasonably practicable thereafter give notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of the refusal, to the person concerned and the registered institution concerned and specifying his reasons.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an executive officer is, or was at any time, guilty of misconduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Monetary Authority has ceased to be satisfied that an executive officer of a registered institution—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a fit and proper person to be such type of officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has sufficient authority within the institution to be such officer,

subsection.continued: then the Monetary Authority may, after consultation with the Securities and Futures Commission, by notice in writing served on the officer and the institution—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: withdraw the consent; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: suspend the consent for such period or until the occurrence of such event as the Monetary Authority specifies.

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality of subsection (4) or the operation of any other provisions of this Ordinance, for the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the Monetary Authority may exercise his power under that subsection wholly or partly on the basis of information disclosed to the Monetary Authority by the Securities and Futures Commission, and whether or not the information arises from an investigation under section 182 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).
The Monetary Authority shall not exercise his power under subsection (4) against an executive officer without first giving the officer an opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority decides to exercise his power under subsection (4) against an executive officer, the Monetary Authority shall inform the officer of his decision to do so by notice in writing served on him, and the notice shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for which the decision is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time at which the decision is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, the duration and terms of the withdrawal or suspension of the consent to be imposed under the decision.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority has exercised his power under subsection (4) against an executive officer, the Monetary Authority may disclose to the public details of the decision he has made under that subsection, the reasons for which the decision was made, and any material facts relating to the case. (Added 19 of 2005 s. 14)

Without prejudice to the exercise of any powers by the Securities and Futures Commission under the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), the Monetary Authority may make such recommendations to the Securities and Futures Commission concerning any executive officer in respect of the exercise of the power under section 196 or 197 of that Ordinance as he considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: has taken into account any written representation received by him from the executive officer,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing served on the executive officer and the institution, attach conditions to the consent, or amend conditions attached to the consent, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded for the purposes of subsection (1) as becoming an executive officer of a registered institution if he is appointed to serve as an executive officer of it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately on the expiration of a previous term by him as an executive officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the same regulated activity as he was such executive officer in that previous term.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Misconduct
def.leadIn: misconduct (失當行為), in relation to an executive officer, means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: a contravention of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any conditions attached under subsection (2)(b), or attached or amended under subsection (9), to the consent under subsection (1) which relates to the officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any conditions attached or amended under section 71E(3) to the provisional consent under section 71E(1) which relates to the officer; (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 35)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an act or omission of the officer relating to the carrying on of any regulated activity—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the registered institution in relation to which the officer is an executive officer; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, is or is likely to be prejudicial to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest; or (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 35)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an act or omission of the officer that—

subparagraph.leadIn: relates to the carrying on of any activity that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is not a regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the registered institution, in relation to which the officer is an executive officer, may carry on for an open-ended fund company under the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); and
in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, is or is likely to be prejudicial to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest, (Added 16 of 2016 s. 35)

def.continued: and guilty of misconduct (犯失當行為) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: Where any registered institution is, or was at any time, guilty of misconduct within the meaning of paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of the definition of misconduct in section 193(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) as a result of the commission of any conduct occurring with the consent or connivance of, or attributable to any neglect on the part of, an executive officer of the institution, the conduct shall also be regarded as misconduct on the part of the officer, and guilty of misconduct shall also be construed accordingly. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 35)

For the purposes of paragraphs (c) and (d) of the definition of misconduct in subsection (12), the Monetary Authority shall not form any opinion that any act or omission is or is likely to be prejudicial to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest, unless he has had regard to such of the provisions set out in any code of conduct published under section 169 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) or any code or guideline published under section 112ZR or 399 of that Ordinance as are in force at the time of occurrence of, and applicable in relation to, the act or omission. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 35)

section.name: s71D
section.heading: Appointment of executive officers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 71F—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered institution incorporated in Hong Kong must appoint at least 2 executive officers, each of whom must be an individual, to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business conducted by the institution that constitutes a regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered institution incorporated outside Hong Kong must appoint at least 2 executive officers, each of whom must be an individual, to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business in Hong Kong conducted by the institution that constitutes a regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a registered institution incorporated in Hong Kong includes a registered institution that is a re-domiciled entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a registered institution incorporated outside Hong Kong excludes a registered institution that is a re-domiciled entity.

section.name: s71E
section.heading: Grant of provisional consent in relation to persons seeking Monetary Authority’s consent under section 71C(1) to be executive officers

subsection.content: Where a person seeks the consent under section 71C(1) of the Monetary Authority to be an executive officer of an authorized institution, then the Monetary Authority may, upon the request of the person, and in his absolute discretion but subject to subsection (2), give provisional consent to the person to be such executive officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority shall refuse to give provisional consent under subsection (1) to a person unless the person satisfies the Monetary Authority that the giving of the consent will not prejudice the interests of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: depositors or potential depositors of the registered institution concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investing public.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may give provisional consent under subsection (1) to a person subject to such conditions as the Monetary Authority thinks proper to attach thereto, and the Monetary Authority may at any time, by notice in writing served on the person and the registered institution concerned, attach conditions to the consent or amend conditions attached to the consent, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: The attachment or amendment under subsection (3) of conditions shall take effect at the time of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: giving the provisional consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: service of the notice concerned under that subsection or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later,

subsection.continued: as the case may be.

subsection.content: A provisional consent given under subsection (1) to a person shall be deemed to be revoked when the person and the registered institution concerned are given notice under section 71C(3) of the Monetary Authority’s decision to give, or refuse to give, consent under section 71C(1) for the person to be an executive officer of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, having regard to the interests of the depositors or potential depositors of the registered institution concerned or of the investing public, and in his absolute discretion, withdraw provisional consent given under subsection (1) to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by giving notice in writing to the person and the institution withdrawing the consent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with effect on such date as is specified in the notice, being a date not earlier than 7 days after the notice is so given.

section.name: s71F
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to sections 71C and 71D in the case of certain registered institutions
section.content: Neither section 71C nor section 71D shall apply to or in relation to a registered institution during the period within which the institution falls within paragraph (a) of the definition of registered institution.

section.name: s72A
section.heading: Monetary Authority may require specified persons to submit information

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, specified person (指明的人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person who proposes to become a controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong; (Replaced 95 of 1991 s. 21)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: any person who is a relevant individual within the meaning of section 20(10); (Added 6 of 2002 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who is the chief executive of an authorized institution or an executive officer of a registered institution; (Amended 6 of 2002 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person who is a director or controller of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong; or (Amended 95 of 1991 s. 21)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any person who is seeking the consent of the Monetary Authority under section 71(1) or 71C(1). (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25; 6 of 2002 s. 11)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may require a specified person to submit such information as he may reasonably require for the exercise of his functions under this Ordinance and such information shall be submitted within such period and in such manner as the Monetary Authority may require. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25; 94 of 1993 s. 21)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Subject to section 53B(3), where an authorized institution becomes aware of the fact that any person has become or has ceased to be a specified person in respect of the institution, the institution shall, not later than 14 days after becoming aware of that fact, give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of that fact. (Added 95 of 1991 s. 21. Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25; 49 of 1995 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: Any specified person (other than a person referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (d)) who fails without reasonable excuse to comply with any requirement under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 95 of 1991 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 3 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: Any specified person who signs any document for the purposes of complying with any requirement under subsection (2) which he knows or reasonably ought to know to be false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 8 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Any specified person who produces any book, account, document, security or information for the purpose of complying with any requirement under subsection (2) which is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 8 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Every director, every chief executive and every manager of an authorized institution which contravenes subsection (2A) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues. (Added 95 of 1991 s. 21)

section.name: s72B
section.heading: Notification of appointment of manager, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution shall, not later than 14 days after the date on which a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: became a manager of the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceased to be a manager of the institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in his capacity as a manager of the institution, became principally responsible, either alone or with others, for any of the affairs or business of the institution specified in the Fourteenth Schedule in addition to, or in place of, any other such responsibility he has or had in that capacity,

subsection.continued: give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority and the person of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: that date;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: particulars of the affairs or business of the institution in relation to which the person became or has ceased to be such manager (including any case which falls within paragraph (c)); and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: in the case of the notice to the Monetary Authority, such other particulars of the person as the Monetary Authority may require for the exercise of his functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an authorized institution is not required to comply with subsection (1) in respect of a manager appointed bona fide on a temporary basis.

subsection.leadIn: Where in respect of the appointment of a manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has not complied with subsection (1) by virtue of subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment subsequently ceases to be on a temporary basis,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: subsection (1) shall, on the date on which that cesser occurs, apply in respect of the manager; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: that date shall be the date mentioned in subsection (1) from which the period mentioned in that subsection shall be calculated within which the institution shall comply with that subsection in respect of the manager.

subsection.leadIn: Every director, every chief executive and every manager of an authorized institution which contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at tier 7 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at tier 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine at tier 2 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Certain persons prohibited from acting as employees of authorized institutions except with consent of Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: No person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is bankrupt or has entered into a composition with his creditors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been convicted in any place of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: knows, or ought reasonably to know, that, in respect of an authorized institution of which he is or was a director or is or was a chief executive or manager thereof— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 18)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the institution is being, or has been, wound up or otherwise dissolved; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its licence or registration, as the case may be, has been revoked, (Replaced 94 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.continued: shall, without the consent in writing of the Monetary Authority, become an employee of an authorized institution (or, where paragraph (c) is applicable, of another authorized institution) or, if becoming such an employee without such consent, act, or continue to act, as such employee. (Amended 82 of 1992 s. 25; 94 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: No person who on or after becoming an employee of an authorized institution (and whether or not he became such an employee before, on or after the relevant day)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes bankrupt, or enters into a composition with his creditors, on or after the relevant day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is convicted, on or after the relevant day, in any place of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: knows, or ought reasonably to know, that, in respect of another authorized institution of which he is or was a director or is or was a chief executive or manager thereof— (Amended 32 of 2001 s. 18)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the institution is being, or has been, wound up or otherwise dissolved on or after the relevant day; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its licence or registration, as the case may be, has been revoked on or after the relevant day,

subsection.continued: shall—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a) or (b), continue to act as such employee without the consent in writing of the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of paragraph (c), continue to act as such employee either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: unless he has notified the Monetary Authority of that prior employment together with a request that the Monetary Authority grant consent to him to continue to act as such employee; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the Monetary Authority refuses to grant such consent. (Added 94 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority refuses to grant consent under subsection (1) or (1A) he shall notify the person concerned in writing of his refusal as soon as practicable. (Added 94 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority has granted consent under subsection (1) or (1A) to a person where paragraph (c) of that subsection is applicable to the person, then that paragraph shall not again be applicable to the person in the case, but only in the case, of the authorized institution referred to in that paragraph which gave rise to that paragraph being applicable to the person. (Added 42 of 1999 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (1A) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 94 of 1993 s. 22)
